interjection: 1. Used alone to tell someone you are happy at what they have achieved, done or won. English = 'Congratulations!'
verbLexeme: 1. To say good things to someone because of something they have succeeded in doing or won. English = congratulate.
2. To be enjoyed or liked by most people. English = (be) popular.
nominalLexeme: 1. The good things you say to someone for something they have succeeded in doing or won. English = congratulations.
2. The quality of something that is liked, known or enjoyed by most people. English = popularity.
